page.title: 04Soil and its uses
page.content: The three areas of wasteland from which soil samples were taken all showed{clay}to be the chief constituent. The disused pit which had been filled in was mainly{sand.}These areas were all covered with grasses and flowers of the{pea}family such as {tufted vetch}and{clovers.}An area of the recreation ground which had been recently disturbed contained more sand and there were few grasses here, but a large variety of wild flowers, none of which were well established. Cultivated areas had soil of which clay was the chief constituent, but gardens which had been treated with compost or had a large number of trees contained more{humus.}Most gardens had over half the area grassed, about a quarter with flowers and the rest as vegetables, trees or shrubs.
